headline: Why Sandisk (SNDK) Is Up 20.1% After Upbeat Q1 Results and Improved Guidance
summary: SanDisk Corporation recently reported first-quarter 2026 results, revealing sales of US$2.31 billion and net income of US$112 million, alongside new second-quarter revenue guidance of US$2.55 billion to US$2.65 billion. Ahead-of-plan progress in achieving net cash positive status and continued robust demand in data center and consumer markets point to shifting growth priorities post-separation from Western Digital. We'll explore how SanDisk's robust customer demand and technology adoption...
